intro: Logania serpyllifolia subsp. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved logania, is a flowering plant species native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers with five petals. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, giving it its subspecific name. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
